page.title: 18HOUSES AND HOMES IN RUNCORN
page.content: Halton village lies two miles from Runcorn town centre and was built upon sandstone rock;similarly the castle which is situated in the Castle Village.Main street has houses dating from 1500_1938,and is bordered by the New Town.A sandstone wall runs the whole length of the village.The 15th century cottages and old chapel house of 1818, are under a conservation order.The Elizabethan Seneschal's House lies one end of the village and the gatehouse,dated 1818,lies at the other.The John Cheshyre Library in Castle Road is dated 1736 and contains old chained books,some of which refer to the Pendle Witch Trials.Opposite is Hill House,a Tudor residence which was once thatched.Used in the 1850's as an "Ale House",it became a vicarage in 1904.
